meanings.definition: The power or authority of a lord over his lands and subjects.
meanings.sent1: The seignory of the lord extended far and wide, governing all in his realm.
meanings.sent2: The seignory of the nobleman included vast estates and many loyal subjects.
meanings.sent3: The lord's seignory was so vast that even the birds in the sky obeyed his commands.
meanings.sent4: In the seignory of the lord, the trees whispered secrets only he could understand.
meanings.sent5: The seignory of the noble was as unyielding as the mountains themselves.

meanings.definition: A territory or domain over which a lord holds power.
meanings.sent1: The seignory of the baron was known for its fertile fields and bustling villages.
meanings.sent2: The lord's seignory stretched from the rolling hills to the shimmering lakes.
meanings.sent3: In the seignory of the noble, even the rabbits seemed to bow in respect.
meanings.sent4: The seignory of the duke was a realm where time itself seemed to slow down.
meanings.sent5: Within the seignory of the count, every blade of grass bore his mark of ownership.

meanings.definition: The position or rank of a lord or noble.
meanings.sent1: Hereditary seignory was passed down from generation to generation in the noble family.
meanings.sent2: The young prince aspired to attain the seignory of his ancestors one day.
meanings.sent3: The seignory of the duchess came with both privileges and responsibilities.
meanings.sent4: In the grand hall, the lords and ladies vied for the coveted seignory.
meanings.sent5: The seignory of the earl was marked by his regal presence and commanding voice.
